question: Who is the second-longest consecutively serving current non-royal national leader in the world, as of 2020?
explanation: Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo is the second-longest consecutively serving current non-royal national leader in the world, as of 2020, while the first leader is Paul Biya of Cameroon. He has been the second President of Equatorial Guinea since August 1979, therefore in power for 41 years. He came to power through a military coup. He has overseen the emergence of Equatorial Guinea as a major oil producer of Africa.
